'''Boldog''' was an [[Orcs|Orc]]-name<ref>{{MR|Index}}</ref> that was given to [[Maiar]] that took on the physical form of a primitive [[Orc]].<ref>{{MR|P5X}}, Author's note</ref>

== History ==
Boldog was a title taken by many of the servants of [[Morgoth]] that appeared multiple times during the [[Battles of Beleriand]].<ref name=ORC>{{MR|P5X}}, Author's footnote</ref> While some bearers of the Boldog title may have been no more than ''"delusions and phantoms"'', many others that bore the name took on shapes that mocked and degraded [[Elves]] and [[Men]].<ref>{{MR|P5X}}</ref> These ''"Orc-formed Maiar"'' were said to be ''"only less formidable than the [[Balrogs]]"''.<ref name=ORC/>

Boldogs were apparently, similar to [[Melian]], capable of embodied procreation. Doing so, however, would make them more and more earthbound, unable to return to spirit-state. Due to this diminishment, when they were slain they would be dwindle in force and be 'damned' and reduced to impotence.<ref>{{MR|P5VII}}</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Boldog'' is [[Noldorin]] for "Torment-slayer", from ''baul'' ("torment") and ''daug'' ("warrior").<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entries "ÑGWAL", "NDAK"</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
[[File:Tom Loback - Thingol fights Boldog.jpg|thumb|right|''Thingol fights Boldog'' by [[:Category:Images by Tom Loback|Tom Loback]]]]

According to the early version of the [[Legendarium]] within the ''[[Lay of Leithian]]'',<ref>{{LB|Index}}</ref> '''Boldog''' was the name of an Orc-captain that was the leader of a raid into the [[Dimbar|north-marches]] of [[Doriath]] and tasked by [[Morgoth]] to capture [[Lúthien]] and bring her to [[Angband]], for reasons undisclosed. However, the [[Iathrim]] defeated the invading army<ref>{{LB|C12}}</ref> with Boldog himself being slayed by [[Thingol]].<ref>{{LB|3U}}</ref> Some time later, when [[Finrod]], [[Beren]], [[Edrahil]] and their companions were brought before [[Thû]] clad within Orc-form, they said that they were a part of the army under the command of Boldog, and had urgent news to deliver to [[Thangorodrim]] - but Thû saw through their disguise, revealing to them that Boldog was slain.<ref>{{LB|C7}}</ref>
